intro: Tetrataenium kumaonense, commonly known as the Kumaon tetrataenium, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region of India. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
